revised_title: The Mechanisms of Event Recall through Associations between Elements of Experience
tldr: This article discusses a form of recall where some elements of an event trigger the recall of the entire event by forming associations between pairs of elements. The study assesses the conditions that enable the use of direct and indirect associations for simple and progressive recall procedures. The author presents a neural model to explain the process and explores its relationship to known physiological mechanisms in the cerebral cortex and hippocampal formation.
